intro: Lippia renifolia, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, slightly hairy leaves and clusters of small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed areas and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and fragrant foliage. Lippia renifolia is also known for its medicinal properties, with various traditional uses in folk medicine.
